1.title: Queen Margaret
1.plot: "Was't you that revell'd in our parliament, and made a preachment of your high descent?" Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Margaret", played by Stephen Costan, as he revels in his defeat of the rebel York in a dystopian near future, complete with kingly feast. "Off with the crown, and with the crown his head"

2.title: Edmund
2.plot: "Thou, nature, art my goddess; to thy law My services are bound." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Edmund", played by Falon Ryan, as she wrests with the complexities of the word "legitimate" as a woman looking for her place in a male-dominated world.

3.title: Thomas More
3.plot: "Imagine that you see the wretched strangers, their babies at their backs ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Thomas More", played by Christopher Kirby, as he tries to convince a group of parliamentary peers the errors of their ways. "What do you do to your souls in doing this?"

4.title: Viola
4.plot: "I left no ring with her. What means this lady?" Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Viola", played by Nadine Garner, as she navigates the world of love and gender fluidity in Shakespeare's "Twelfth Night". "O time, thou must untangle this, not I. It is too hard a knot for me t'untie"

5.title: Katherina
5.plot: Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Katherina", played by Wahibe Moussa, as she faces the realities of being a woman in a man's world and who has learned to dance to the tune of politics to get what she most desires.

6.title: Henry V
6.plot: "Once more unto the breach, dear friends, once more ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Henry V", played by Billy Smedley, as he faces not just the enemy, but the anxieties of his men at a time when he needs them most. "The game's afoot ..."

7.title: Hamlet
7.plot: "I have of late, though know not why, lost all my mirth ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Hamlet", played by Michala Banas, as she faces the realization that no matter how much you appear to have, you are, in the end, only human. "What is this quintessence of dust?"

8.title: Jaques
8.plot: "All the world's a stage and all the men and women merely players ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Jaques" played by Alan Fletcher as he discovers that being the life of the party isn't always as easy as it appears. " - one man in his time plays many parts, His acts being seven ages."

9.title: Cleopatra
9.plot: "All's but naught ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Cleopatra" played by Tariro Mavondo as she faces the loss of the man who gave her strength and was taken too soon from her side. " - This case of that huge spirit now is cold ..."

10.title: Helena
10.plot: "I love your son". Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Helena" played by Shane Savage as he is forced into a confession of love for a man he knows may never love him back to the woman who is both the object of his affections' mother and his direct employer. "Do not hate me for loving where you do ..."

11.title: Sebastian
11.plot: "My stars shine darkly over me ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Sebastian" played by Phoebe Anne Taylor as she faces the loss of her sister and the consequences of now being all alone in the world. " - mine eyes will tell tales of me."

12.title: Beatrice
12.plot: "Too cursed is more than cursed ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Beatrice" played by Sally McLean - a rebel with a love of life and penchant for parties, who, despite her fine dresses, high heels and glamourous lifestyle knows a woman is more than the sum of her parts. " - Father, as it please me."

13.title: Iago
13.plot: "I follow him to serve my turn upon him ..." Meet Shakespeare Republic's "Iago" played by Dean Haglund as he plots his revenge - scheming in plain sight like the viper in the blossom. " - I am not what I am."

1.title: Macbeth
1.plot: "If it were done when 'tis done, then 'twere well it were done quickly ..." Come on a journey into the darker recesses of human ambition as we meet a modern day, but equally murderous Macbeth as he wrestles with his conscience in a dilemma all too familiar to the Australian public. "I have no spur to prick the sides of my intent, only vaulting ambition ..."

2.title: Hamlet
2.plot: Hamlet suspects his uncle has murdered his father to claim the throne of Denmark and the hand of Hamlet's mother, but the prince cannot decide whether or not he should take vengeance.

3.title: Hamlet
3.plot: "Speak the speech, I pray you ..." An imagined meeting behind the scenes at the highest level as we meet Hamlet played by Billy Smedley (Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries) giving us a taste of what it must be like to be a political media adviser in the current climate. " - to show virtue her own feature, scorn her own image, and the very age and body of the time his form and pressure."

4.title: Juliet
4.plot: "O Romeo, Romeo. Wherefore art thou, Romeo?" Meet our "Jules" played by Ben Steel (Home and Away, Winners and Losers) who gives us an insight into how modern romance operates, glitches and all, in a digital age. "Deny thy father and refuse thy name."

5.title: Phebe
5.plot: "Think not I love him though I ask for him ..." Meet Phebe, played by Michala Banas (Upper Middle Bogan, Nowhere Boys), as she gives us an uncomfortable insight into unrequited romantic obsession and the dangers of having access to modern communication devices when one too many alcoholic drinks have been imbibed. "I will write to him a very taunting letter ..."

6.title: Billie
6.plot: "Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?" And so, all good things must come to an end. In our final episode for Season One of Shakespeare Republic, meet Billie, played by Sally McLean (Utopia), as she shares with us arguably Shakespeare's most famous sonnet in a truly Australian setting - with a factual twist. "But thy eternal summer shall not fade ..."

imdb.plot outline: Shakespeare Republic is a collective of Australian-based actors who have come together to celebrate Shakespeare, his works and his enduring legacy, through sharing their interpretation of his words and thoughts, via settings and circumstances that are familiar to a 21st Century audience.
imdb.title: Shakespeare Republic
plot: Celebrating the brilliance of the Bard - this is _Shakespeare Republic_ (qv). All the world's a stage.::Incognita Enterprises

_Shakespeare Republic_ (qv) is a collective of Australian-based actors who have come together to celebrate Shakespeare, his works and his enduring legacy, through sharing their interpretation of his words and thoughts, via settings and circumstances that are familiar to a 21st Century audience.::Incognita Enterprises

Using some of Shakespeare's most famous monologues and sonnets, each episode is a 'snapshot' of a piece of modern life performed by members of an ensemble made up of a mix of established and up-and-coming actors - all filmed in Melbourne, Australia. Each piece stands as an individual 'moment in time' that highlights how Shakespeare (and his fellow Elizabethan playwrights) were talking about issues and ideas that we are still debating and experiencing today. The takeaway? This series shows that Shakespeare speaks to us now just as strongly as he did 400 years ago when he first put quill to parchment. _Shakespeare Republic_ (qv) - all the world's a stage .::Incognita Enterprises
